title: First of many articles
text:
Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()





Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()





Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Testing GitHub actions for upload
text: So, this is the big moment. Can I use GitHub Actions to update the website without having to run anything myself. If I can, I’ll be super happy.

title: Testing GitHub actions for upload
text:
But what if…
What if I can’t? Well, I’ll just have to try something else.

title: Testing GitHub actions for upload
text:
Will you be disappointed?
Yes, but it’s all trial and error. I’m sure I’ll get it working eventually.

title: Testing GitHub actions for upload
text:
Conclusion
Fingers crossed!
